rrpss

Class RevenueReport

  • Object
    • RevenueReport

  • public class RevenueReport
extends Object
    Prints a restaurant revenue report daily or monthly. This class only consists of Static methods which are capable of printing a revenue report. The revenue report generated can either be a daily report or monthly report, based on the given user input. In order to print a revenue report, the method needs to obtain all order invoices of a Restaurant object through this class method's parameter.
    Author:
    Edwin Candinegara

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RevenueReport()
      Constructs nothing as this class does not have to be instantiated to print the revenue report of a restaurant.

      • Methods inherited from class Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RevenueReport

        public RevenueReport()
        Constructs nothing as this class does not have to be instantiated to print the revenue report of a restaurant. Only OrderInvoice objects need to be passed in to printReport(String, Vector) in order to print the revenue report either daily or monthly.

    • Method Detail

      • printReport

        public static int printReport(String period,
              Vector<OrderInvoice> orderInvoices)
        Traverses through all the order invoice inside the argument orderInvoices to look for OrderInvoice object with the same date or month specified in period. This method differentiates the period, whether it is in the format of DDMMYYYY or MMYYY, by comparing the length of the String period and prints the revenue report accordingly.

        After determining whether it is a daily or monthly report, this method traverses through all OrderInvoice object and stores all OrderInvoice object with the same date or month into another temporary vector object which will be then passed into printReportByDay(Vector) or printReportByMonth(Vector).

        In the case of daily report, printReportByDay(Vector) will be called while printReportByMonth(Vector) will be called for monthly report.

        In case no OrderInvoice object with the correct date is found, this method returns -1. If period is given has the wrong format, this method returns -2.

        Parameters:
        period - A String indicating the period of the revenue report to be printed (must follow the format DDMMYYYY or MMYYYY for daily and monthly respectively)
        orderInvoices - A Vector containing all order invoices of a Restaurant object
        Returns:
        1 if the revenue report is successfully printed, -1 if there is no order invoice with the specified date or month, and -2 if the given period String input is in the wrong format.

      • printReportByDay

        private static void printReportByDay(Vector<OrderInvoice> dailyOrderInvoices)
        Prints all OrderInvoice objects inside the Vector object passed in to this method. Each OrderInvoice object prints a breakdown of ordered items and its total price by invoking OrderInvoice.printInvoice().

        This method also prints the total revenue gained by the restaurant in a day.

        Parameters:
        dailyOrderInvoices - A Vector object consisting of OrderInvoice objects with the correct date as checked in printReport(String, Vector)
        See Also:
        printReport(String, Vector)

      • printReportByMonth

        private static void printReportByMonth(Vector<OrderInvoice> monthlyOrderInvoices)
        Prints the top and least sales of the month with its date. In addition, the total revenue is also printed. The breakdown of each Order object is not needed.
        Parameters:
        monthlyOrderInvoices - A Vector object consisting of OrderInvoice objects within the specified month as checked in printReport(String, Vector)
        See Also:
        printReport(String, Vector)
